intro: Siphocampylus affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Siphocampylus affinis is characterized by its distinctive scent and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
